dialog.text: How do I break my phone addiction? It feels like it's stealing whole afternoons—and I'm tired of that.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: anxious to earnest; Intonation: quick, rising; Speed: a bit fast; Tone: vulnerable

dialog.text: Start by sabotaging it—deliberately make your phone the inconvenient option. Small, deliberate friction wins where willpower fails.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: calm, reassuring; Intonation: steady, confident; Speed: measured; Tone: warm, slightly smiley

dialog.text: Sabotage? That sounds drastic. What does that even look like in real life?
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: curious, hopeful; Intonation: questioning; Speed: moderate; Tone: eager

dialog.text: Once, I promised myself dinner without screens. I left my phone in a locked drawer for a weeknight—awkward at first, but my partner and I actually finished a conversation. Over time those dinners felt like recovery.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: reflective; Intonation: storytelling; Speed: relaxed; Tone: gentle

dialog.text: I can't just disappear—work messages, reminders… what if I miss something important?
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: worried but sincere; Intonation: concerned; Speed: moderate; Tone: realistic

dialog.text: Make compromises that create friction: turn off nonessential notifications, set work-check windows, put your charger in another room, switch your home screen to grayscale, and move social apps off the first page.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: practical; Intonation: clear, instructional; Speed: steady; Tone: empowering

dialog.text: So tiny traps that interrupt the autopilot—okay, I can do tiny.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: tentative optimism; Intonation: softer; Speed: slower; Tone: encouraged

dialog.text: Exactly. Remember: you're not fighting a device, you're rewiring a reward loop. Sabotage the loop and reward a different outcome—a short walk, a single chapter, a real conversation.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: encouraging, slightly inspirational; Intonation: rising toward the end; Speed: measured; Tone: warm, motivational

dialog.text: Tonight I'll put it in a drawer before dinner and set a book on the table instead. Small experiment, one night.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: determined; Intonation: decisive; Speed: steady; Tone: hopeful

dialog.text: Try one sabotage tonight. Reflect on what shifted—what you noticed, what felt empty or gained space—and share your experiment in the comments; your small change might help someone else start.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: inviting, confident; Intonation: calm call to action; Speed: moderate; Tone: encouraging
